description:
Four identical right triangles are inscribed in a square, with their hypotenuses 

coinciding with the sides of the square (see the image). Find the area of the shaded 

figure in the image, given that the length of the hypotenuse of the right triangles is 

'hypotenuse', and the length of the cathetus (leg) is 'cathetus'.

The other leg of the triangle is determined using the Pythagorean theorem,

so it does not matter which leg is longer.

Ensure that both hypotenuse and cathetus are always non-negative numbers.

if hypotenuse and cathetus is equal return 0.

![Description image](https://i.imgur.com/bryEbT8.png)
